skill.name: formik-patterns
skill.description: Formik form handling with validation patterns. Use when building forms, implementing validation, or handling form submission.
skill.summary: Formik form handling with validation patterns. Use when building forms, implementing validation, or ...
skill.author: ChrisWiles

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill containing only code examples and patterns for Formik. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or command execution.

content.value_statement: Building forms in React requires handling validation, state, and submission. This skill provides proven Formik patterns for creating accessible, validated forms with Yup schemas.
actual_capabilities: Create forms with useFormik hook and Yup validation schemas
Build field helper functions to reduce boilerplate
Implement conditional validation based on other field values
Handle form submission with GraphQL mutations and error handling
Create multi-step forms with step-based validation
limitations: Does not generate complete form components automatically
No built-in integration with specific UI component libraries
Does not handle form persistence or offline storage

use_cases.title: Login and auth forms
use_cases.description: Build secure login forms with email validation, password requirements, and error handling.

use_cases.title: Data entry forms
use_cases.description: Create forms that submit to GraphQL APIs with proper loading states and error feedback.

use_cases.title: Complex multi-step wizards
use_cases.description: Implement checkout flows and onboarding wizards with step validation and navigation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic form setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to create a login form using Formik with email and password validation using Yup.

prompt_templates.title: Field validation
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I create a Yup validation schema for a password field that requires uppercase, lowercase, number, and minimum 8 characters?

prompt_templates.title: Form submission
prompt_templates.prompt: Write a Formik form that submits to a GraphQL mutation with proper onCompleted and onError handlers.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-step forms
prompt_templates.prompt: How do I implement a multi-step form with Formik where each step has its own validation schema?

output_examples.input: Create a registration form with email, password, and confirm password fields
output: Use Yup validation with .matches() for password requirements
Set enableReinitialize: true for edit forms
Disable submit button when form is invalid or submitting

best_practices: Always show validation errors only after field is touched to reduce noise
Disable submit button during submission and when form is invalid
Handle both onCompleted and onError callbacks for mutation submissions
anti_patterns: Showing validation errors immediately before user interacts with field
Leaving submit button enabled during async submission
Skipping error handling in form submission handlers

faq.question: What versions of React and Formik are supported?
faq.answer: Works with React 16.8+ (hooks) and Formik 2.x. Yup is used for validation.

faq.question: Can I use TypeScript with these patterns?
faq.answer: Yes. All code examples are TypeScript compatible with proper typing for formik.values.

faq.question: How do I integrate with UI component libraries?
faq.answer: The field helper pattern works with any UI library. Pass {...getFieldProps('fieldName')} to your Input component.

faq.question: Is my form data sent anywhere?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides patterns. Form data stays in your application and is handled by your code.

faq.question: Why are my validation errors not showing?
faq.answer: Ensure you call handleBlur on your fields and check formik.touched[field] before displaying errors.

faq.question: How is this different from React Hook Form?
faq.answer: Formik offers simpler API for basic forms. React Hook Form has better performance for complex forms with many fields.
